com.hannesdorfmann.mosby.mvp.delegate

Interface ActivityMvpDelegateCallback<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    BaseMvpDelegateCallback<V,P>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ActivityMvpViewStateDelegateCallback<V,P>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MvpActivity, MvpLceActivity, MvpLceViewStateActivity, MvpViewStateActivity

    public interface ActivityMvpDelegateCallback<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>
extends BaseMvpDelegateCallback<V,P>
    The MvpDelegate callback that will be called from ActivityMvpDelegate. This interface must be implemented by all Activities that you want to support mosby's mvp.
    Since:
    2.0.0
    See Also:
    BaseMvpDelegateCallback

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Object getLastCustomNonConfigurationInstance() 
      java.lang.Object getNonMosbyLastCustomNonConfigurationInstance()
      This method should invoke ActivityMvpDelegate.getNonMosbyLastCustomNonConfigurationInstance().
      java.lang.Object onRetainNonMosbyCustomNonConfigurationInstance()
      Return any Object holding the desired state to propagate to the next activity instance.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.hannesdorfmann.mosby.mvp.delegate.BaseMvpDelegateCallback

        createPresenter, getMvpView, getPresenter, isRetainInstance, setPresenter, setRetainInstance, shouldInstanceBeRetained

    • Method Detail

      • onRetainNonMosbyCustomNonConfigurationInstance

        java.lang.Object onRetainNonMosbyCustomNonConfigurationInstance()
        Return any Object holding the desired state to propagate to the next activity instance. Please note that mosby internals like the presenter are already saved internally and you don't have to take them into account. You can retrieve this value later with ActivityMvpDelegate.getNonMosbyLastCustomNonConfigurationInstance().

        This mechanism works pretty the same way as FragmentActivity#onRetainCustomNonConfigurationInstance() and getNonMosbyLastCustomNonConfigurationInstance()

        Returns:
        Object holding state.

      • getLastCustomNonConfigurationInstance

        java.lang.Object getLastCustomNonConfigurationInstance()
        Returns:
        Return the value previously returned from FragmentActivity#onRetainCustomNonConfigurationInstance().

      • getNonMosbyLastCustomNonConfigurationInstance

        java.lang.Object getNonMosbyLastCustomNonConfigurationInstance()
        This method should invoke ActivityMvpDelegate.getNonMosbyLastCustomNonConfigurationInstance().

        This method is not really a "callback" method (will not invoked from delegate somehow). However, it's part of this interface to ensure that no custom implementation will miss this method since this method is the counterpart to onRetainNonMosbyCustomNonConfigurationInstance()
